gamepad_test_mapping: This function can be used to set the gamepad mapping on those targets that permit it. You supply the "slot" index for the gamepad to set, and then the map string, which should have been created using the SDL format with the following fields:

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.p:92-3
gamepad_test_mapping: The details that should be included in each of these fields are:

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:94-5
gamepad_test_mapping: guid - a string of digits and letters that uniquely identifies a device type (this can be retrieved using the gamepad_get_guid() function)

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:95-5
gamepad_test_mapping: description - an Ascii description of the device (this can be retrieved using the gamepad_get_description() function)

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:96-5
gamepad_test_mapping: platform-name - will be either "platform:android", "platform:windows", "linux", or "mac" (note that this will be appended automatically onto the string when you call this function, and so you do not need to supply it when constructing your own mapping strings)

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:98-5
gamepad_test_mapping: <tt>bindings</tt> - a set of entries separated by a ',' to bind actual input to specific GML constants

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.p:100-3
gamepad_test_mapping: The comma separated list of entries follows a specific format for each entry:

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.p:102-3
gamepad_test_mapping: Here <tt><value-binding></tt> (ie: the direct gamepad input) can be any one of the following:

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:104-5
gamepad_test_mapping: a<N> - This represents an axis of the gamepad, where the <N> is one of the axis from 0 to gamepad_axis_count() -1

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:105-5
gamepad_test_mapping: b<N> - This represents a button of the gamepad, where the <N> is one of the buttons from 0 to gamepad_button_count() -1

gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.head.title: gamepad_test_mapping.htm+html.body.ul.li:106-5
gamepad_test_mapping: h<N>.<mask> - This represents a hat of the gamepad, where the <N> represents a hat from 0 to gamepad_hat_count() -1, and the <mask> will be either 1, 2, 4, or 8.
